RE: License#: CB810201161
Dear Ms. Page-Sander:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/29/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include
the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living contract
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The contract shall
be reviewed and updated at least once every 90
calendar days and a copy provided to the youth.
One of two independent living files was missing one quarterly updated contract.
CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum
supervision:
(c) Provide the youth with a telephone number to
contact the agency on a 24-hour, 7-days-a-week basis.
One of two independent living files did not have documentation that a phone
number to contact staff was provided.

CPA Rule 400.12607 Agency recommendation
(4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption
with a signed and dated copy of the evaluation and
recommendation upon its completion.
One of three adoption evaluations did not have documentation that a copy of the
assessment was provided to the applicant.
CPA Rule 400.12608 Adoptive family evaluation record
(2) The record shall contain all of the following:
(e) All documents pertaining to adoption evaluation
required by R400.12605.
One of three adoption files did not have the signed application on file.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
The DHS-901, Semi-Annual Transition Plan Report,
must be updated to reflect progress toward goals
during each meeting. Once completed, the DHS-901,
Semi-Annual Transition Plan Report, becomes the
child’s transition plan. A copy of the DHS-901, Semi-
Annual Transition Plan Report, must be given to the
child and all individuals responsible for assisting the
child. The original plan must be uploaded into the
electronic case management record.
One of two independent living files had documentation that a semi-annual
transition plan meeting occurred, but the worker did not complete the required
accompanying report.
ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress Reports
Adoption workers must submit written quarterly
progress reports using the DHS-614, Quarterly
Adoption Progress Report. The adoption worker must
have at least one face-to-face contact with the child
during each quarter prior to the adoption supervision
period for the purpose of completing the DHS-614.
One of three adoption files did not have a quarterly visit with the child
documented from November 2022 to May 2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:

• DHHS Contracts office recently clarified that Medical Passports must be
updated quarterly, even if the youth is a permanent ward and a parent
signature is not required.
• The agency was advised to use the "upload signed copy" and "finalize"
function for special evaluation reports in CWLM.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed. The
CAA indicated the agency has successfully implemented their corrective action
plan from the 2022 Interim Review. However, the agency continues to struggle
with staff retention in the child welfare program. The agency reported several
strategies that have been used to recruit, hire, and retain staff. But there continues
to be a high turn-over rate. The CAA reported additional strategies will continue to
be implemented.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported they enjoy their work and
have manageable caseloads. Both staff stated they have supportive and
knowledgeable supervisors they feel comfortable talking to about concerns.
Neither staff had any suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a business park outside of Ann Arbor. The building is
very large, with several offices, conference and visit rooms. The office has
sufficient locked storage, space for staff, and comfortable family visitation areas.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
